《在绝望之巅》E.M. Cioran 这是一本我个人很喜欢的哲学书，但又与其他哲学书籍不同，这本书没有太多束缚思想的条例和框架，或许因为理性思维无法全面捕捉人性和社会的崎岖，感性思维具有区域性的片面，信仰都散发出时代的傲慢，使得这本书就像是在做一种没有信仰的观察，以一种混乱的姿态去感受荒谬，以自我折磨的方式去面对绝望。
有机物和无机物的根本区别是什么?想象着肉体溶解在流淌的河水中，随着意识的消去，自己的有机性也逐渐消失，我们存在于物质，而又依存于意识，追求着本来就不存在的协调性，回过头来望去发现早已走在了痛苦的人生旅途上，而放眼望去前面则是如期而至的死亡，即便此般绝望也相信着存在能带来永恒的意义。书中齐奥郎带给我们的是更灼热的思想温度，是后现代思想的启示，是一部进步的文学及哲学作品。
《关于痛苦的七堂哲学课》Scot Samuelson 痛苦是每个人不可逃避的人生话题，书中阐述揭示了三种现代看待痛苦的方式以及四种古代看待痛苦的方式，其中看待痛苦的三种现代方式尤其让我深刻。面对痛苦，人们最直观的对待方式是消除它，这也正是第一种对待痛苦的现代思想，即痛苦应被消除的功利主义方式，但是我们要以什么为基准来衡量世界上的“好”与“坏”，“幸福”与“不幸”呢？这种功利主义思想带来了一些道德悖论，以绝对的观点去对待发展的事物难免会引来问题，而尼采以永恒轮回的思想实验质疑了前者功利主义的痛苦观，在循环的轮回中就算痛苦减少了，人生也会缺少意义，而正确面对痛苦的方式是去拥抱它，但持有这种观点的尼采也一直生活在混乱与痛苦当中，或许他会觉得他度过了饱满意义的一生，但是一般人真的会觉得这样的生活是值得的吗？
最后一种现代痛苦观点是来自汉娜阿伦特，我认为是基于现代社会生产关系的一种观点，劳动（labor）是重复性且从事劳动并不能在社会中体现个人的价值和独特性，即任何人都可以取代你来完成劳动，而工作（work）则是包含个人意义且能将自我与社会区分开来的，从事劳动是一种无聊且痛苦的过程，单靠劳动无法推进发展因为劳动自身是带有一成不变的重复性的，反观工作是打破轮回的，是具有进步意义的，我个人认为劳动与工作的冲突是永恒轮回在资本主义社会中痛苦观的表现方式，而化解两者之间矛盾的方法是依靠发展，一方面发展打破了轮回的无意义，另一方面通过发展也减少了劳动的痛苦。
《你想活出怎样的人生》 吉野源三郎 我想每个人小时候多多少少会有因为一己私欲而导致了不可挽回的过错，当这些过错成为了某个人生节点的分水岭时，它会阴魂不散地缠着我们，因为它是自我的另一种可能，另外一种生活状态，这个时候难免会回过头想，要是有一个知通客观规律，对道德与人性有根本掌握的人生导师给予我们指导那该会有多好。《你想活出怎样的人生》就是描写了这么一个成长环境下某个小男孩的成长故事。
我们每个人都有一个名为“自我”的小屋子，在屋外是世界的洪流，在我们感官尚未成熟时我们会难以准确地捕捉“自我”的边界，以致于我们频频犯错，我们会通过实践来认识社会与自我的边界，使得这个边界具体化，最后成为规范个人行为的一种准则。
书中小男孩出生在一个相对富裕的家庭，因为父亲早逝，男孩的舅舅就成为了他精神沟通的渠道，男孩对个体与社会的关系感到茫然，对生产与消费的社会关系感到矛盾，同时也对班上同学们对个体的偏见感到不公，在一次次挫折的经历中，舅舅都以客观和全面的态度去开导小男孩，并将每次事件中更深层次的意义写在信里，以便小男孩足够成熟后去阅读。
这种跨越年龄的沟通方式让我印象非常深刻，虽然我们普遍认为学校有别于社会，所以在学校中的学生与社会中的社会人有本质上的差距，而我认为事实上两者在形式上确实有所不同，但是学校与社会依旧是由人组成的社交圈子，因为事物是普遍联系的，所以学校中我们面临的矛盾也会以不同的形式出现在社会中。基于这种社会共性，不同阶级和身份的人就有了一种沟通的标准，我个人非常向往那种跨越身份跟年龄的沟通，不以权利身份来分配话语权，而是基于社会共性和准则来进行平等沟通，希望自己也能以这种方式与他人交往。
《The Book of Lost Things》 John Connolly What separates “goods” from “bads”? Could harmony persists if we remove all bads from our society? Even if removal of all bads are possible, one could hardly imagine a meaningful life without adversary. Just like the protagonist in “The Book of Lost Things”, through the journey of David’s adventure, he comes to realize that life is not like a fairy tale story. No matter how one beautifies a victorious war, it’s still about brutality and death. And relationship is not as pure and inocent as “The Seven Dwafs and Snow White”: There is no such thing as destined love.
As hard as it might seem, David has to take in the fact that his mother is gone forever and consequently he has to live with his stepmom and his half-brother. Bearing the disapointment towards his dad and jealously towards his half-brother, he escaped to a fantasy world that is filled with nasty desires of greed, lust and craving of power. On top of that, a creepy monster has offered a false promise to David that if he is willing to sarcrify the life of his half-brother, he could return to the wonderful life that he used to enjoy. Despite the temptation, David stood up to face the adversary. Along with the ups and downs in the journey, David has found the value of moral and the truth behind the fantasy wolrd, which is that by taking an easier path to fufill his selfish will, he will never obtain the happiness he seek and his guilt will haunt him forever.
On the other side of the coin, I think the fantasy world is merely a reflection of David’s own desires. Inivitably, we all have an angel and an evil in our mind during the process of making moral decision. What David has done is to acknowledge the existence of the evilness that lives within each of us and then to fight against it. In doing so, he has made the right decision in reality. Probably this is a process we all have to go through in the stage of growing. A process to realize that the “goods” coexisted with the “bads”. One could never eliminate all the “bads” because the “bads” come naturally from our instinctive desire.
《生命是什么》 薛定谔 物理是一门对物质特征与运动进行科学描述的学科，我们要如何将物理学运用到生命的描述上呢？《生命是什么》这本书就是薛定谔对这个问题的深刻思考。
书中其中一个出发点是思考和推论可能承载生命信息的物理结构。是什么样的内在结构构成了生命的复杂性？其复杂性体现在生命体与外界世界交互的非线性反映，因此结构重复的晶体结构固然不会成为生命组成部分，薛定谔推论生命的构成单位有着不同的排布方式以此来承载生命的复杂性和多样性，也就是我们今日熟知的DNA了，同时，在常温下热力系统跟随Boltzmann的速率分布，所以对生命的组成部分必须得在这能量浮动的环境下保持其本质特征，即在常温下的化学稳定性，所以薛定谔推论生命的内在结构是由在常温下稳定的化学键位组合而成的，在一个还未有人知晓DNA的年代下薛定谔就以物理学的角度揭开了DNA的面纱，其中以上的两点与现代的DNA理解相符。
以物理的必然性去看待生命的复杂性在当时年代是具有先见性的思维方法，薛定谔这类观点也对生命科学起了重要的指导作用。不过仔细想想，在现代也不缺少用物理学的角度去学习复杂的问题，就例如社会学与经济学，但都不见得有比生物学中有影响力，或许社会学与经济学中有了跨越精神性的特征，人类思想的精神性承载了其复杂性的一部分，所以也使得难以物理学的必然性去捕捉其特征，而反观生命科学虽说有着难以预测的复杂性，但其物理结构还未跨越精神性，所以薛定谔的推论才如此准确。
《后来的事》夏目漱石 《后来的事》是一个一百年前的故事，但即使在一百年后的现在，书中描写的人与物也依旧能反映出后现代一种静止的社会生活状态。故事主人公代助是商人家庭里的次子，代助了解社会关系的构成也清晰地表达着对其的不满，而一方面自己从来不认真地对待自己的欲望，以致于难以背负起社会责任，而恰好其中主人公的好友平冈则是亲身融入到社会生产的环节当中，一方面是为了保护理想和理想的自己久久无法实践的主人公代助，而另一方面是通过实践而饱受现实与理想不协调的好友平冈，两者是生存与生活的矛盾体现，文中里面有这么一个对话
我是失败了，但失败了还得干。我打算继续干下去。看到我的失败，你在笑了。哦，即使没笑，反正同笑是殊途同归，所以大可不必咬文嚼字。你看，其实你是在笑了。你在笑我，但你自己呢，不是什么也没有干吗？你对世上的事，一切照单全收。换句话说，你是个不会让自己的意志舒展的人。若说没有意志，那是谎言，因为毕竟是人嘛,而始终感到不满足就是最好的说明。我呢，我要用我的意志来影响现实社会的发展，我一定要在这个现实社会中找到确凿是为我的意志所左右的产物——哪怕是一丁点——否则我就无法生活下去。我认为这就是我这个人存在的价值。
这是平冈的立场和追求，同时也是对代助无所事事的社会状态的一种批判，对于平冈而言，个人的意义基于个人发展与社会进步的相关性，而对于代助而言，或许一切社会进步都是非自然的状态，在对话的下半部分
你呢，只知道思索。正因为光思索，所以头脑里的世界同现实中的世界各自存在着。你忍受着这种极不调和的现象，无形中已是你的一大失败了，对不对？若问何以见得，你可以想想，我把那种不调和的现象披露出来，你却把它压在里面。正因为我把它披露在外，所以我真正失败的次数会减少些。但是现在我是受你笑话，我却不能笑你，哦，不，尽管我很想笑你，但社会一定认为我是不能笑你的吧。“
理想与现实必然有所冲突，放任现实自由发展固然是一种方式，但这就意味着不加入社会的生产环节，而一旦不参与社会生产就难以产生社会关系，作为人的社会性欲望就会被淡化，如同代助漂浮不定的生存状态一般。或许一切人类的生存矛盾都是基于物质与精神的二重性，即人存在于物质但又依存于精神，而包容两者的发展条件是理想的妥协。
我个人非常喜欢作者描写故事发展和人物特征的方式。故事角色的发展体现了故事的真实性，而形形色色的角色交互体现了故事的立体性，当作者想描述一个角色时，他并不是单纯地从那个角色的社会特征出发，而是先从内到外，再从外到内地对一个角色进行描述，一个人能从镜子中看出自己的轮廓，也能从自己的社会环境对自己的评价得知自己的社会构成。在故事推进的角度来讲，故事的发展也是人物的发展，因为人物的冲突促进了故事发展，而故事发展也推进了人物的变化，最后呈现给读者的是一个细腻和现实的故事，读者能见证一个对现实漫不经心的青年逐步展露真心以致自己最后变得自由得一无所有的故事。

title: 2023阅读总结

content:
Quantum Mechanics is formulated by serveral axioms. But different from other branches of physics, ones could hardly relate the axioms of quantum mechanics(QM) to their daily experience which makes QM such a weird and fascinating subject to study.
Though not having a relatable daily experience, those axioms reflect some profound structure of the nature if we turn our scope to the information theory and group theory. For example, a unitary evolvution is required transformation of the quantum states is closely related to the special unitary group in group theory. Bearing this motivation in mind, this note serves to state the seven axioms of quantum mechanics introduced in the book “Experimental Approach of Quantum Mechanics” by, and then explore its intuition in branches of mathematical physics.
Quantum Mechanics is conceptually different from Classical Mechanics Russel Bertrand exitence with observation. A chair will still be there no matter your eyes are open or not.
Physical law are description of reality. Here we have two distincitve ways of describing the reality. One being quantuam mechanics and another being classical mechanics. Starting with classical mechanics which we are familiar with, a particle of mass m with with spatial coordinate will evolve under the force field descirbed by Newton’s second law.
$$ \vec{F(\vec{x})} = m \frac{d^{2} \vec{x}}{dt^{2}} $$
or written in the form of potential energy
$$ -\Del{U(\vec{x})} = \vec{F{\vec{x}}} = m \frac{d^{2} \vec{x}}{dt^{2}} $$
and the total energy could be written as
$$ \int{\vec{F}d\vec{x}} = \int{-\Del U d\vec{x}} = \int{m \frac{d^{2} \vec{x}}{dt^{2}} d\vec{x}}$$
leading to
$$ E = U + K $$
where U is the potential energy and K the kinetic energy of the particle. Here we restrict our attention to the non-relativistic mechanics where the spatial coordinate and the time coordinate are uncorrelated measurement along its independent axis.
Note that Newtonian mechanics is non-linear, meaning some solutions to the equation of motion cannot be linearly composed and still satisfies the equation of motion.(state vector and spatial coordinate) Secondly, knowing the force fields and the initial conditions directly determines the trajectory of the particle from the start to end. (entropy)
A side note to the above equations, there is another derivation of Newton’s law that is more mathematically elegant and insightful which is the derivation from action principal.
Time invariant leads to conservation of energy. Spatial invariant leads to conservation of momentum.
Stating the Postulates Rule 1: A dynamical system corresponds to a Hilbert space in such a way that a definite state of the system corresponds to a definite ray in the space. a state \(\left| u \right\rangle \)if it corresponds to the ray in the direction of vector \(\left| u \right\rangle\) complex factor and phase factor don’t change its state linear combination of definite state produces another possible state linear superposition principle relative phase between states matters An isolated quantum mechanical system can evolve with time unitarily. The evolution is continuous and causal.
let \( t>t_{0} \), then
$$ \left| u(t) \right\rangle = U(t, t_{0})\left| u(t_{0}) \right\rangle$$
For small \( t-t_{0} \Rightarrow U\) must differ only infinitesimally from the identity if it’s continous
$$ U(t_{0} + \delta t, t_{0}) = I - i K \delta t $$
where K is Hermitian.
By dimensional analysis, \( U(t_{0} + \delta t), t_{0} =I - \frac{i}{\hbar}H\delta t \)
$$ \left|u(t_{0} + \delta t) \right\rangle = \left( I - \frac{i}{\hbar}H\delta t \right) $$
Time dependent Schroedinger equation $$ H \left| u(t) \right\rangle = i\hbar \frac{\delta \left| u(t) \right\rangle }{\delta t} $$
$$ i\hbar \delta_{t} \left[ U(t, t_{0})\left|u(t_{0}) \right\rangle \right] = HU(t, t_{0}) \left| u(t_{0}) \right\rangle$$
Hamiltonians at different times commute
$$ \frac{\delta}{\delta t} U(t, t_{0}) = -\frac{i}{\hbar} H U(t, t_{0}) $$
Providing that H does not depend on time $$ U(t, t_{0}) = e^{\left[-\frac{i}{\hbar}\int_{t_{0}}^{t}H(t^{\prime})dt^{\prime}\right]} $$
if H does not commute at differen time, expansion about identity
$$ e^{\left[-\frac{i}{\hbar}\int_{t_{0}}^{t}H(t^{\prime})dt^{\prime}\right]_{t}} $$
Rule 2: An isolated quantum state evolves continously and casually in time by a unitary operator U. $$ \left| u(t) \right\rangle = U(t, t_{0}) \left | u(t_{0}) \right\rangle $$
where \( U(t, t_{0}) = e^{\left[-\frac{i}{\hbar}\int_{t_{0}}^{t}H(t^{\prime})dt^{\prime}\right]}\)
Rule 3: Each observable of a system is associated with a Hermitian operator on the Hilbert space of the system. We assume that the eigenstates of each observable form a complete set. Rule 4: The result of any given measurement of an observabble is an eigenvalue of the corresponding Hermitian operator. Rule 5: The average \( \bar{A} \equiv \left\langle A \right\rangle \) of a number of measurements of \(A\) is $$ \bar{A} \equiv \left\langle A \right\rangle = \frac{\left\langle u|A| u \right\rangle}{\left\langle u|u \right\rangle} $$
With \( u \) an eigenstate of \( \Rightarrow \left| u \right\rangle = \left| \phi_{i} \right\rangle \), \( A \left| \phi_{i} \right\rangle = \lambda_{i} \left|\phi_{i} \right\rangle \) $$ \bar{A} = \frac{\left\langle \phi_{i}|A| \phi_{i} \right\rangle}{\left\langle \phi_{i}|\phi_{i} \right\rangle} = \lambda_{i} \Rightarrow \triangle^{2} = \left\langle A^{2} \right\rangle - \left\langle A \right\rangle ^{2} $$
With \( u \) not an eigenstate of A $$ \left| u \right\rangle = \sum_{i} \left| \phi_{i} \right\rangle \left\langle \phi_{i} \right| \left| u \right\rangle $$
\(u\) in basic of \( \phi_{i} \)
$$ \bar{A} = \sum_{i, j} \frac{\langle u | \phi_{i} \rangle \langle \phi_{i} | A | \phi_{j} \rangle \langle \phi_{j} | u \rangle}{\langle u | u \rangle} = \frac{\sum_{i} \lambda_{i}|\langle u | \phi_{i}\rangle |^{2}}{\sum_{i} | \langle u | \phi_{i} \rangle |^{2}}$$
$$ \bar{A} = \frac{\sum_{i} P_{i} \lambda_{i}}{\sum_{i} P_{i}} $$
Rule 7: A measurement of observable \( A \) resulting in eigenvalue \( \lambda_{i} \) projects the state vector from \( |u\rangle \) to that subspace of the Hilbert space associated with \( \lambda_{i} \). If the eigenvalue is nondegenerate, the subspace is just a single eiggenstate \( \phi_{i} \) associated with \( \lambda_{i} \). If \( |u\rangle \) is already an eigenstate of \( A \), it’s not changed by the measreument. If \( u \) is not an eigenstate of \( A \), then in the nondegenerate case it ‘collapses’ to \( \phi_{i} \) with probability \( |\langle u | \phi_{i} \rangle |^{2} \) Rule2 and Rule 7 macroscopic objectification problem
If \( [A, B] = 0 \), then \(A\) and \(B\) are simultaneously diagonalized by the same unitary transformation
If A, B, C, … form a complete set of commuting (compatible) observables then we know everythig there is to know about the steate of the system when we specify the eigenvalue of each of A, B, C, … for that state
This is called a complete set of quantum numbers for that state
$$ \frac{d\langle A \rangle}{dt} = \left(\frac{ d \langle u |}{dt}\right) A |u\rangle + \langle u | A \left(\frac{d |u \rangle}{dt}\right) + \langle u | \left(\frac{\delta A}{\delta t}\right) | u \rangle $$
Employing \( H|u\rangle = i\hbar \delta_{t} |u\rangle \) and \( \langle u | H = -i \hbar \delta_{t} \langle u | \)
$$ \frac{d\langle A \rangle}{dt} = \frac{i}{\hbar} \left[ \langle u | HA | u \rangle - \langle u | AH | u \rangle \right] + \left\langle u \left| \frac{\delta A}{\delta t} \right| u \right\rangle $$
$$ = \frac{i}{\hbar} \langle u | [A, H] | u \rangle + \left\langle u \left| \frac{\delta A}{\delta t} \right| u \right\rangle $$
Carry out unitary transformation into a new basic in which \( u \) is a constant.
$$ S(t, t_{0}) = U^{\dagger}(t, t_{0}) = e^{\left[ -\frac{i}{\hbar}\int_{t_{0}}^{t} H(t^{\prime}) dt^{\prime} \right]^{\dagger}} $$
Giving us the Heisenberg equation for uncertainty
$$ A^{\prime} = SAS^{\dagger} = U^{\dagger}AU \Rightarrow \frac{dA^{\prime}}{dt} = \frac{1}{i\hbar} [A^{\prime}, H] + \frac{\delta A^{\prime}}{\delta t}$$

summary:
Quantum Mechanics is formulated by serveral axioms. But different from other branches of physics, ones could hardly relate the axioms of quantum mechanics(QM) to their daily experience which makes QM such a weird and fascinating subject to study.
Though not having a relatable daily experience, those axioms reflect some profound structure of the nature if we turn our scope to the information theory and group theory. For example, a unitary evolvution is required transformation of the quantum states is closely related to the special unitary group in group theory.
